dialog: My name is Captain James Tiberius Kirk of the United Federation of Planets.
I am appearing before you as a neutral representative of the Fibonan Republic.
I bring you a message of goodwill and present to you esteemed members of the Teenaxi Delegation, a gift from the Fibonan High Council with the highest regard.
Why don't they want it anymore?
Uh, well, this was once a piece of an ancient weapon, and now they offer it as a symbol of...
In the Fibonan culture, to surrender a weapon is an offer of truce.
How did they come by it?
They told me they acquired it a long time ago.
No, they, um... Well, I don't know.
You don't know the Fibonans like we do!
They're a crowd of untrustworthy thieves who want to see us murdered in our own beds!
This beloved artifact is a symbol of trust and peace.
They want to chop us into pieces and roast us over a fire!
No, no... I don't think that's true.
Scotty! Get me out of here!
There's quite a bit of surface interference, sir.
Captain, did you manage to broker a treaty with the Teenaxi?
Uh... Let's just say I came up short.
Will you, uh, log that and put it in the vault, Spock? Thank you.
You got that little vein popping out of your temple again. You okay?
Just another day in the fleet.
Today is our 966th day in deep space, a little under three years into our fiveyear mission.
The more time we spend out here, the harder it is to tell where one day ends and the next one begins.
It can be a challenge to feel grounded when even gravity is artificial.
But, well, we do what we can to make it feel like home.
The crew, as always, continues to act admirably despite the rigors of our extended stay here in outer space.
And the personal sacrifices they have made.
We continue to search for new life forms in order to establish firm diplomatic ties.
Our extended time in uncharted territory has stretched the ship's mechanical capacities.
But fortunately our engineering department, led by Mr. Scott, is more than up to the job.
The ship aside, prolonged cohabitation has definitely had effects on interpersonal dynamics.
Some experiences for the better, and some for the worse.
As for me, things have started to feel a little episodic.
The farther out we go, the more I find myself wondering what it is we're trying to accomplish.
If the universe is truly endless, then are we not striving for something forever out of reach?
The Enterprise is scheduled for a reprovisioning stop at Yorktown, the Federation's newest and most advanced starbase.
Perhaps a break from routine will offer up some respite from the mysteries of the unknown.
Keenser's leaking some kind of highly acidic green goo, and Scotty's terrified he's gonna sneeze on the warp core and kill us all.
What the hell are you drinking?
Uh, I'm pretty sure it's the rest of that Saurian brandy we picked up on Thasus.
My God, man, are you trying to go blind?
Besides, I found this in Chekov's locker.
I mean, I always assumed he'd be  a vodka man.
I wanted to have something appropriate for your birthday.
Uh, that's in a couple days.
You know I don't care about that.
I know. I know you don't like celebrating it on the day because it's also the day your pa bit the dust.
Did they teach you about bedside manner in medical school?
Are you gonna call your mom?
Yeah, of course. I'll call her on the day.
Yep, that's usually how it works.
A year older than he ever got to be.
You joined to see if you could live up to him.
Uh, you spent all this time trying to be George Kirk and now you're wondering just what it means to be Jim.
To perfect eyesight and a full head of hair.
I'm on my way, Mr. Sulu.
Let's keep this birthday thing under wraps, huh?
Yeah, you know me. Mr. Sensitive.
Aye, she's a beauty, isn't she?
Couldn't we just rent some space on a planet?
Showing geographical favoritism among inducted Federation worlds could cause diplomatic tension.
Oh, you don't think that looks tense?
Looks like a damn snow globe in space just waiting to break!
I think you should have this back.
After all, it belonged to your mother.
It's not in the Vulcan custom to receive again that which was given as a gift.
You know, Spock, if an Earth girl says, uh, "It's me, not you," it's definitely you.
May we have a moment of your time?
You know I've never been here?
What I hear is that the bars here are excellent.
I'm so glad you guys could come.
Thank you for bringing this to my attention.
You are not authorized for approach.
We were on a science mission inside the nebula.
Our ship suffered a critical malfunction.
I took an escape pod before the ship crash landed on a nearby planet.
We need a ship capable of navigating the nebula.
You must have someone who can help us.
We tracked her stranded ship to a sector of uncharted nebula, here at 210 mark 14.
Well, the Enterprise does have the best navigational system in the fleet.
The only ship here with more advanced technology is still under construction.
But it's not just the ship that I'm sending.
Starfleet command sent me your application for the Vice Admiral position here at this installation.
If I may, I would recommend Commander Spock replace me as Captain of the Enterprise.
He is an exemplary Starfleet officer.
It isn't uncommon, you know, even for a captain, to want to leave.
There is no relative direction in the vastness of space.
There is only yourself, your ship, your crew.
It's easier than you think, to get lost.
I'll bring it up with the General Council.
We'll discuss it when you return.
After this mission, we should, uh, sit down.
There's something I need to talk to you about.
I as well have something to share.
We make a good team. Right?
Lieutenant Uhura, open a shipwide channel.
Rescue a crew stranded on a planet in uncharted space.
Our trajectory will take us through an unstable nebula, one which will disable all communications with Starfleet.
We're gonna be on our own.
The Enterprise has something no other ship in the fleet has, you.
And as we've come to understand, there is no such thing as the unknown, only the temporarily hidden.
Mmm. Readings indicate cloud density diminishing, sir.
But limited to no life forms on the surface.
We have an unknown ship heading right for us.
I am picking up some kind of signal.
Sir, our phasers are having minimal effect and our torpedos can't track their movements!
Captain, we are not equipped for this manner of engagement.
Shield frequencies have no effect, sir!
Warp us out of here, Mr. Sulu.
Why the hell aren't we moving?
I can't engage the warp drive, sir!
I cannae, sir! The nacelles, they've...
Active protocol 28 Code One Alpha Zero.
Sir, I have hull breaches in levels 12 to 15, Captain! There's a chance I can reroute the energy reserves from the warp core to the impulse engines.
If we can get back into the nebula, maybe we could lose them.
Do whatever you have to, Scotty.
Fit the plasma conduits and stand by to reroute on my mark!
I have identified the individual who appears to be leading the attack party.
He infiltrated the archive vault and removed the artifact from our mission on Teenax.
We are losing the inertial dampeners!
Emergency bulkheads are sealing, but structural integrity is at 18% and falling, sir!
We need to give those pods a chance to escape.
Can you lead those ships away?
Impulse engines are still trying to draw power from the warp reserve.
We cannot move until the saucer is separated.
Get him up. Help him up.
We've got to get you guys to an escape pod. Go.
The saucer should be free by now!
Impulse engines drawing power from auxiliary generators.
How many of the crew are still aboard the saucer?
But if I'm reading this correctly, the intruders are taking them.
Captain, we are caught in the planet's gravity.
You knew. You knew we'd be attacked.
Chekov, check the comms for survivors.
He took my crew. Like he took yours.
How did he know so much about the Enterprise?
All I know is that if I did this, he would set them free.
Chekov, are you picking anything up on those scanners?
We have to find that saucer.
Even minimal scanning systems will have more range than a tricorder.
How do you know our language?
I am Lieutenant Nyota Uhura of the U.S.S. Enterprise.
And you have committed an act of war against the...
Federation is an act of war.
Why did you sacrifice yourself for him?
He would have done the same.
And if he made it off of that ship, he will come for us.
I am counting on it, Lieutenant Uhura.
The forced optimism in your voice suggests that you are trying to elicit a sense of calm in order to...
Doctor, I fail to see how excrement of any kind bears relevance on our current situation.
Whoa, whoa, what the hell are you doing?
Spock, this thing's punctured your iliac region!
That's exactly what I'm trying to tell you.
Look, if I can't take this out, you're gonna die.
Okay? If I take it out and can't stop the bleeding, you're gonna die.
I can see no appeal in either option.
Believe it or not, neither can I.
So, if I remember correctly, the Vulcans have their hearts where humans have their livers.
That explains a thing or two.
I just don't get it, Spock.
I mean, what did they attack us for?
I mean, they do all this for some doodad that the tiny critters didn't want?
It is unwise to trivialize that which one simply does not understand, Doctor.
We can safely assume it is more important than a doodad.
I think you just managed to insult me twice, Spock.
All right, Spock, I just got one question.
I fail to see the relevance.
Yeah. They say it hurts less if it's a surprise.
If I may adopt a parlance with which you are familiar, I can confirm your theory to be horseshit.
We got to get out of here.
And, uh, who might you be?
I'm pretty handy when I want to be, all right?
We certainly showed them, eh, lassie?
Uh, but I'm feeling generous today, so have at it.
I learn it from my house.
Means that I'm an officer of Starfleet.
You're not with those bastards that killed my ship, are you?
I'll take that as a no.
He is Krall. Him and his bees.
They search the stars for a death machine.
They're the reason why you here.
They have fallen from the sky, like me and you.
Wait, no... Hang on a minute, lassie.
I'm having a difficult day here.
I've got to find my crewmates.
I will help you find your mates.
And then you will help me.
You want me to fix something?
Yes. You help me, and I help you.
All right, well, things being as they are, I doubt I'll get a better offer today, so, lead the way.
She may not even have power to the Bridge, Captain.
She still has a few tricks up her sleeve.
Hey, take it easy there, Spock.
That was just a temporary fix back there.
These symbols are the same as those depicted on the artifact taken in the attack.
You think it came from here?
You do not want to set off my traps.
Hold on a minute. Is this a ship?
I help you find your friends and you help me fix it.
So I can leave this planet forever.
Wait a minute. Is this your ship?
Captain, it looks like there is power.
All right, let's get to the Bridge and find the crew.
I will try to reroute power to it.
Once we get this place lit up, we're gonna draw a lot of attention.
What do you think, can you find them?
I am reconfiguring scanners to modulate for the crew's signals.
That is one heck of a cold.
All right, we got about 15 minutes until the next guard rotation. Come on.
The Federation was using these to find a way through the nebula.
He's been piggybacking the subspace links between the probes.
Can we use it to send a distress signal?
He's got Starfleet data files, ship logs, including the Enterprise.
He's been watching us this whole time.
Captain, the artifact was on the ship the whole time?
I couldn't afford to get caught with it, so I hid it in here.
Tell Krall I have the Abronath.
Do you believe every sad story you hear?
Aye, Captain, I have traced the location of her call.
What does Krall want with this thing?
Aye, Captain, but we are trapped!
Can you get this thing started?
Are you intimating that we should engage the thrusters?
I am open to other suggestions.
The fuel is primed, but I cannot get it to combust.
Oy, Captain, we are basically standing on a very large bomb.
If you miss the combustion compressor...
I'm not gonna miss, come on.
Do you even know what the combustion compressor looks like?
You think you know what sacrifice really means?
Federation has taught you that conflict should not exist.
But without struggle, you would never know who you truly are.
You have no idea who we are.
You mean the distress signal you thought you sent?
Your rescue ships will be stranded in the nebula and your base left vulnerable.
Millions of souls from every Federation world holding hands.
You're wrong. There is strength in unity.
The strength of others, Lieutenant, is what has kept me alive.
I'm simply contemplating the nature of mortality.
Massive blood loss will do that to you.
You asked me why Lieutenant Uhura and I parted ways.
I became concerned, in the light of Vulcan's demise, that I owed a debt of duty to my species.
You thought you should be off making little Vulcans, huh?
Yeah, I can see how that would upset her.
I intended to discuss it with her further, but I received some news which affected me unexpectedly.
I can't imagine what that must feel like.
When you've lived as many lives as he, fear of death is illogical.
Fear of death is what keeps us alive.
I want to live as he did.
That is why I decided to redirect my efforts and continue his work on New Vulcan.
What did Jim have to say about that?
I could not find the time to tell him.
Well, I can tell you he's not gonna like that.
Hell, I don't know what he'd do without you.
I mean, me on the other hand, I'd throw a party, but...
How far are we from the coordinates of that call?
When did you begin to suspect her?
I guess you could say I've got a good nose for danger.
Where on earth is that coming from?
I plugged the little box in the power cell and the little mouths make it sing.
Music's a bit oldfashioned for my taste, not to mention very loud and distracting, but, aye, well played.
I like the beats and shouting.
Someone set off one of my traps.
That wee man there is Pavel Chekov.
And that handsome bastard is James T. Kirk.
It's good to see you, sir.
She sure knows how to throw out a welcome mat.
I do not know what is a welcome mat.
I'm sorry, you're the only ones.
What the hell happened up there, Jim?
They were after the artifact we brought back from T eenax.
I had to get it off the Enterprise, put it on a shuttle.
You hid it in a shuttle.
This is the U. S. S. Franklin, sir.
First Earth ship capable of warp 4.
Went missing in the Gagarin Radiation Belt in the early 2160s.
I remember that from the Academy.
One of the first heroes of Starfleet.
How the hell did his ship end up here?
There's a lot of theories, sir.
Captured by a giant green space hand.
This far out, it's got to be a wormhole displacement.
She's missing a few driver coils and the EPS conduits are fried, but Jaylah has done a marvelous job of getting the ship's systems back online.
Mr. Chekov, can you plug in the coordinates.
See if you can track the crew's location from the ship's sensors.
No clue what happened to the crew, huh?
No, sir. They'd be dead a hundred years by now.
My dad used to have one when he was a kid.
My mom said he'd put her on the back of it, drive her nuts.
So you're telling me this thing's been here this whole time and no one's ever noticed it?
So, like some sort of holographic camouflage.
I have intercepted a weak communications transmission, sir.
Can you lock on to the signal?
Yes, but how do we get to them?
But I'm gonna need your permission.
Why would you need my permission?
Because if I mess it up, I don't want it to be just my fault.
McCoy and Spock to Enterprise crew.
Come on, you can make it.
Leaving me behind will significantly increase your chances of survival, Doctor.
Well, that's damn chivalrous of you, but completely out of the question.
It is imperative that you locate any surviving crew.
And here I was thinking you cared.
I always assumed my respect for you was clear.
The dialogue we have had across the years has always...
You don't have to say it.
Well, at least I won't die alone.
Good to see you in one piece, Doctor.
I feel like my innards have been to a barn dance!
Aye, well, these old transporters were only ever used for cargo, but a few modifications seem to do the trick.
I thought it best to beam you one at a time, though.
You know, in case you got spliced.
I couldn't imagine a worse scenario.
Good to have you back. You all right?
In a pig's eye, you are!
Captain, we discovered that the stolen artifact appears to have come from this planet.
Are there any medical supplies on this thing?
All right. Lie down. Come on.
How are we gonna get out of this one, Spock?
We've got no ship, no crew.
We will do what we have always done, Jim.
We will find hope in the impossible.
Let's get you patched up first, okay?
You must focus your efforts on helping the crew.
Well, that's why I need you around, Spock.
These things are from the dark ages.
I'm pretty sure this is a protoplaser.
"The miserable have no other medicine But only hope." Death's door and he's quoting Shakespeare.
If the universe is truly endless...
What seemed so clear to me two years ago now seems, well, far away.
You will tell me where it is!
Let him go and I will give you what you want!
Lieutenant, unity is not your strength.
We should wait until we're absolutely sure.
No, we have to get the crew back now.
Chekov has the coordinates that can lead us to Krall's base, so we go!
With respect, sir, how do we know that Krall was at the base when she called him?
Even if he was, we don't know that the crew is even with him.
Or if they're even still alive.
Mr. Chekov, can you reconfigure the search parameters in order to compensate for this formula?
Aye, Commander, but what is this formula?
A mineral unique to Vulcan which emits lowlevel radiation.
I will have to filter out all other energy emissions.
Spock, what the hell would a Vulcan mineral be doing way out here?
Where are you going with this?
Lieutenant Uhura wears a Vokaya amulet which I presented to her as a token of my affection and respect.
You gave your girlfriend radioactive jewelry?
But its unique signature makes it very easy to identify.
You gave your girlfriend a tracking device.
I'm glad he doesn't respect me.
I am detecting a very trace amount of Vokaya.
Does the location match the coordinates you acquired from Kalara, Mr. Chekov?
Its presence suggests that Lieutenant Uhura and thereby the rest of the crew are being held at Krall's base of operation.
No, sir. There is some geological interference that is blocking the transporter signal.
Well, I guess we're gonna have to go in and break them out the oldfashioned way.
You cannot go to this place.
Everyone who goes there, he kills.
You've been there? You've seen it?
Well, why didn't you say something, lassie?
Because I know you will ask me to take you there.
If your friends are there, then they will die, just like my family.
And I will not go back to that death place!
Aye, but if you've escaped, then you can show us the way in and the way out.
No! This is not the deal we made, Montgomery Scotty.
If you choose to do this, you are on your own.
Look, that's our friends out there, lassie. Right?
We cannae just leave them behind.
Now, we could really use your help.
We just need you to be brave, is all.
When we were in that place, Krall would come and take someone.
And we would not see that person again.
We did not know who would be next.
But we were seen by the one they call Manas.
My father fought him so I could get out.
He was brave and Manas killed him.
Right. My wee granny used to say, "Ya cannae break a stick in a bundle." You're part of something bigger now, lassie.
Right? Dinnae give up on that.
'Cause we'll sure as hell never give up on you.
That is what being part of a crew is all about.
Is that what you believe in, James T.?
All I know is we stand a better chance with you.
The digging machines uncovered a tunnel that goes into the crater.
So that'll be our way in.
An away team will beam to the other side of the tunnel, follow it to Krall's base, get inside the building and break out the crew.
Uh, Captain, we cannot lock onto anyone inside the crater in order to beam them out.
Oh, I could rig up pulse beacons as pattern enhancers.
That'd get the signal out of the crater.
How many people can the Franklin transport at a time?
Uh, with a wee bit of modification, 20 max, but I'm not sure how long it would hold out.
Bones, Mr. Chekov, Jaylah, you're with me on the away team.
Mr. Scott, modify that transporter and then do everything you can to get this ship operational.
Captain, Mr. Chekov's technical acumen makes him more valuable aboard the Franklin with Mr. Scott.
It is thereby logical that I would replace him.
You just got back on your feet.
Lieutenant Uhura is in that facility, Jim.
I'll keep an eye on him.
What we require is a diversion.
I think I have an idea.
It was used by the Ancient Ones as a weapon.
But when they could not control its deadly power, they split it into two and ejected the halves into space, hoping it would be lost forever.
I have spent lifetimes searching for it, only to have you find it for me.
The world that I was born into is very different from yours, Lieutenant.
We knew pain. We knew terror.
These are myths the Federation would have you believe.
You might even believe them, but there's something else going on with you.
What are you doing with her?
You already got what you wanted!
The Federation has pushed the frontier for centuries.
This is where it begins, Lieutenant.
This is where the frontier pushes back.
I've got to admit, that's a hell of a distraction.
Get the remainder of the crew to safety.
Okay, Mr. Chekov, increase the signal.
We're gonna grab them 20 at a time.
Let's hope this doesn't get messy.
Clearly, I am here to rescue you.
Good to see you, wee man.
Ten seconds until the transporter's recharged, Doctor.
Damn it, man, we're not leaving without them!
We're ready for you next, Captain. Just turn on your beacon.
Aye, sir. Everyone except you and Jaylah.
Hit the beacon and we'll grab you.
You take my house and you make it fly.
Scotty, can you get this thing started?
Flying, sir, that's a different thing.
These old vessels, they were built in space.
They were never supposed to take off from atmosphere.
They're called starships for a reason, Captain.
Because I didn't want to disappoint you, you know, in case you didn't make it back.
The attack on Yorktown may be just the beginning.
Armed with this bioweapon, he could rid it of all life and use the base's advanced technology to attack an untold number of Federation planets.
Then we're just gonna have to get this thing flying.
We cannae just jumpstart it, sir!
You can, you know, fly this thing, right?
Ready as she'll ever be, sir.
That's what I like to hear. All right.
Bones, where are we with the crew?
I could use a functioning medbay, but otherwise we're secure down here.
Mr. Sulu, we have to achieve terminal velocity in order for the stabilizers to provide lift.
Are you sure this drop is high enough to do that?
Mr. Chekov, be ready to hit the forward stabilizers full on my mark.
We should belt up. Go on. Go!
Let's not break her in half.
No reply to allfrequency I.D. request.
Please proceed to designated safety zones immediately.
Please proceed to designated safety zones immediately.
I'm picking up distress signals from every frequency coming from Yorktown.
Mr. Scott, what kind of weapons do we have?
Uh, we have pulsed phase cannons and spatial torpedoes.
Maybe, uh, maybe we lure them away.
How do we get Yorktown time to get people to safety?
No, we are a horse and buggy compared to those things.
We're barely holding together as it is, Captain.
Captain, the flight patterns of bees are determined by individual decisions.
Krall's swarm formations are too complex not to rely on some form of unified cyberpathic coordination.
What he's saying is that if we disorient the swarm we can kick its ass!
Scotty, can you beam me onto one of those swarm ships?
Captain, my familiarity of the interior of those ships, however brief, makes me more qualified for this away mission.
I acknowledge and respect your concerns.
Perhaps you would feel more confident if I were accompanied by someone with familiarity of both the ship and my injury.
You want me to do what?
You know, next time you have a piece of pipe stuck in your transverse, call a plumber.
Just make sure you find a way to break those things.
If it gets hairy, I'll beam you straight back.
Damn it, Jim, I'm a doctor, not a...
You do realize the last time I flew one of these things we crashed.
So don't blame me if we...
Captain, from what I can ascertain, the ships do indeed share a cyberpathic link which coordinates their actions.
They weren't jamming us, they were talking to each other.
Well, how do we get them to stop talking?
We could use the transporters, disrupt their network.
The focus might be too specific.
If we could plant some sort of disruptive communication signal inside the swarm, it might adversely affect their capacity to coordinate.
It would have to be at a frequency they will not anticipate.
We could cause a chain reaction that would wipe out the whole swarm.
Sir, a closed network like that might be susceptible to very high frequency.
Radio. We can broadcast something from the ship to drown out their link.
Break it? You're getting an upgrade.
Swarm ships are 60 seconds from breaking through!
I've just got to reconfigure the VHF output into a multiphasic sweep.
All right. Captain, we're ready to broadcast.
But the signal won't travel far.
Put us right in the middle of that thing.
The swarm ships are doubling back!
They are forming an attack wave, sir.
I think we got their attention.
Spock, stand by to drop out of formation.
Scotty, you all cued up back there?
I have the beat and shouting.
Faster, Doctor. We risk being consumed by their trajectorial decay.
I see it, I see it!
Yes, Doctor, it would seem to be.
Lieutenant Uhura, make sure Yorktown has the frequency to broadcast.
Sir, we now have the disruption frequency.
We are fine, Captain, but there are still three ships heading into Yorktown.
Do whatever it takes to stop him from using that weapon.
We've lost the polarization of the hull plating!
I can reroute the power from the dilithium chambers.
And I need you, Jaylah. Let's go!
You're more than welcome to switch places with me, Spock.
Captain, intercepting all three ships is an impossibility.
Get me a schematic of Yorktown!
Mr. Chekov, can you do a bioscan of Central Plaza?
Bones, there's a city plaza coming up.
You gotta make sure Krall heads for it.
Now I've just got to figure out how to land.
Captain, I have three hull breaches from the impact.
Deck 3, the cargo bay, and the engine room.
All right, Sulu, Chekov, check the cargo bay and Deck 3.
We need confirmation that the weapon has been neutralized and Krall is dead!
It's some kind of energy transference.
We would have seen him leave.
Sulu, contact Yorktown security and lock down the ship.
Scotty, I need you to link into the Franklin database.
Find out what you can about Balthazar Edison.
The captai n of the Franklin?
I don't know how, but Edison is Krall.
His record goes back way before the Federation even existed.
He was a major in the United Earth Military Assault Command Operation.
His military service came to an end when MACO was disbanded.
They made him a captain and gave him the Franklin.
Of the crew, only three remain.
The indigenous race abandoned this planet long ago.
They left behind sophisticated mining equipment and a drone workforce.
They have some sort of technology that prolongs life.
I will do whatever it takes for me and my crew.
The Federation do not care about us.
You'll probably never see me again.
But if you do, be ready.
Why has he not used his weapon yet?
'Cause he wants to find somewhere to inflict maximum damage.
They have to circulate air here, right?
Aye, sir. There's an atmospheric regulator at the core.
Make sure they shut it down  until we find Krall.
How would he access the core?
Uh, well, there's a maintenance tower at the station's gravitational nexus.
Make sure it gets shut down!
Look, this thing is impossible to shut down.
Aye, well, we'll see about that.
Mr. Scott, why is that thing still on?
We're working on it, sir, but as you can imagine there's a lot of safety protocols surrounding the thing that, you know,  keeps everybody alive.
Gravity's gonna get a bit screwy the closer you get to the center.
Maybe we should scan the operational schematics,  see if there's a back door.
Lassie, I'm gonna need your eyes.
What happened to you out there, Edison?
I have to say, Kirk, I've missed being me.
We lost ourselves but gained a purpose!
A means to bring the galaxy back to the struggle that made humanity strong.
Lost millions to the Xindi and Romulan Wars.
For the Federation to sit me in a captain's chair and break bread with the enemy.
Or we spend the rest of our lives fighting the same battles.
There's no way you can make it back there.
I read your ship's log, Captain James T. Kirk.
At least I know what I am.
Peace is not what I was born into.
Captain, he's using the gravitational slipstream to carry him back to the center.
Captain, we have to stop the processor now or everything breathing in Yorktown is dead!
Better to die saving lives than to live with taking them.
That's what I was born into.
Captain, I think we can redirect it.
